About

New York, New York

About Me

I am a Master of Chinese Economic and Political Affairs with experience in policy analysis, quantitative and qualitative research, and policy evaluation. My work focuses primarily on China, spanning economic impacts of BRI, the Chinese legal system, and various dimensions of great-power competition.

With a command of Mandarin and deep familiarity with Chinese institutional structures, I provide nuanced perspectives that go beyond surface-level reporting and pride myself on grounding analysis in primary sources, historical context, and quantitative analysis.

Beyond my academic and professional pursuits, I practice judo at Kokushi Budo Institute, along with sambo at New York Combat Sambo. In my free time, I volunteer at a cat shelter, Flatbush Cats, and enjoy reading when I can.

Political Economy Chinese Economy Geopolitical Risk Mandarin (Professional) Spatial Analysis Data Analysis Policy Research Micro-Econometrics
Selected Projects

Research & Projects

01

Chinese Infrastructure Aid in East Africa and Impact on Development

A spatio-temporal analysis on the economic impact of Chinese infrastructure aid in East Africa. Tracks the construction of roads and changes in night-time lights over time, measuring how one of the main pathways for trade in the region can open up with infrastructure aid.

Belt and Road BRI Quantitative
↗ 02

Close Gubernatorial Elections and Corrections Spending, 1977–2022

An examination of close gubernatorial elections from 1977 to 2022 and the impact this has on corrections spending using regression discontinuity design. Results show a treatment effect from close elections, incentivizing elected officials to tend towards bipartisan or median policies.

RDD Quantitative Causal Inference
↗
